name: Get your current rate limit status
description:
Note: Accessing this endpoint does not count against your rate limit.



**Understanding Your Rate Limit Status**

The Search API has a [custom rate limit](/enterprise/2.12/v3/search/#rate-limit), separate from the rate limit governing the rest of the API. For that reason, the response (shown above) categorizes your rate limit by resource. Within the `"resources"` object, the `"search"` object provides your rate limit status for the [Search API](/enterprise/2.12/v3/search). The `"core"` object provides your rate limit status for all the _rest_ of the API.

The `"rate"` object (shown at the bottom of the response above) is deprecated.

If you're writing new API client code (or updating your existing code), you should use the `"core"` object instead of the `"rate"` object. The `"core"` object contains the same information that is present in the `"rate"` object.
